body.name: Kasa 2K QHD Security Camera Pan/Tilt, Starlight Sensor for Color Night Vision, Motion Detection for Baby & Pet Monitor, 2-Way Audio, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa & Google Home (KC410S)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 3 hrs 49 mins
FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 3 hrs 49 mins
features: Person/Motion/Sound Detection in Real-Time. Day or Night: With cutting-edge AI algorithms, KC410S can detect people, motion and sound to notify on your smart phone even at night with the night vision (30 ft. away in the dark). Customize up to 4 activity zones around areas which are important to make most use of cameras for home security as a baby monitor, pet camera or nanny cam.Controller Type:Google Assistant;Amazon Alexa.Connectivity protocol:Wi-Fi.Power source type:Corded Electric.Operating Temperature : 0°C~40°C (32°F~104°F). Adapter Input : 100-240 VAC, 50/60 Hz, 0.2 A. Adapter Output : 5.0 VDC, 1.0 A..Compatible devices : Tablet, Smartphone. Power source : Corded Electric.

Secure Your Videos Locally or with AWS Cloud: As an indoor security camera, KC410S continuously records and stores footage or video clips on a local MicroSD card up to 256 GB (MicroSD card not included). Premium cloud storage options are available with industry-standard 128-bit AES end-to-end encryption on AWS.

Enjoy a Smarter Home with Smart Actions: Set your lights to turn on when your camera detects motion with Kasa Smart Actions. Smart Actions allows you to create interactions between your Kasa camera and other Kasa devices to make your life simpler. No need to check your Kasa Spot Pan Tilt throughout the day. Get automatic alerts when it detects motion or sound.

Voice Control: For additional ease of use, pair the Kasa wireless camera with Alexa echo or Google assistant. Use a simple voice command to ask Alexa or Google Assistant to view your live camera feed on compatible Alexa or Google devices. System Requirements iOS 10+, Android 5.0+
body.description: Get the full picture of any space in your apartment, dorm or home with the Kasa Spot Pan Tilt. Capture more delicate details and vivid colors than 1080p with sharp and crisp 2K HD. Provides outstanding image quality even when you zoom in with more pixels. Receive instant alerts and live stream 2K HD video to your smartphone, Alexa or Google Assistant supported display. The Spot even provides HD video up to 30 ft. with Night Vision. KC410S continuously records and stores footage on a local MicroSD card up to 256 GB (MicroSD card not included). Premium cloud storage options are available.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page See More Details Capture more delicate details and vivid colors than standard 1080p with sharp and crisp 2K video. Smart Detection Kasa Spot can recognize people, motion, and sound with custom push alerts straight to your phone. Starlight Vision The sensitive starlight sensor captures colorful images even in low-light environments. Wider Dynamic Range With WDR capability, KC410S reduces overexposure and reveals details even when looking out a window. Next page 1 Vivid 2K Video 2 Smart Detection 3 Starlight Vision 4 Exposure Adaption

Advanced Motion Tracking When motion activity is detected, Kasa Spot Pan Tilt tracks and follows the subject to keep it within the camera’s field of view. Patrol Mode Set unique viewpoints and program your camera to keep an eye on each region at custom time intervals.

Customizable Activity Zones Control what alerts you receive by creating multiple custom activity zones around areas that matter. Watch, Speak, Hear Watch live video from anwhere and communicate instanly with the built-in microphone and speaker. Local and Cloud Storage Save footage continuously on a microSD card*. Or subscribe to a Kasa Care Plan for 30-days of cloud storage and additional benefits. Quick and Easy Setup Follow the step-by-step in-app instructions within the Kasa Smart app to be up and running with your new camera.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, really good!
reviews.reviewText: After using this for a very short time, I found it's very easy to set up with the app. Easy to move as needed when not mounted to adjust the view. Can also move the camera within the app. The SD card entry slot is hidden under the black camera. Roll the camera upwards and the slot is under there. No instructions came in the box except to download the app so, I had to look in the listing to figure that out. Picture is crisp and clear. Can turn audio, 24/7 recording, motion sensor, and volume on/off/up/down very easily. Can subscribe to the recording option to be able to access the snapshots of activity. Subscripton price is reasonable at $3/month or $30/year. So far, everything works, including the subscription options. 1 month free trial was provided. I will update this review in a few months or as needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My husband loves this. He checks on the dog all the time. I thought it was battery operated but it is not. It does not work when the power goes off. It probably wouldn't anyway because the internet goes out as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality- great price
reviews.reviewText: I bough this camera as an upgrade from a blink camera. Let me tell you how happy I am that I did. Not only did my blink require a subscription to record and save video but it didn’t move and the camera quality was crap, and it always disconnected from my internet. This solved all of my problems, better quality, it’s moves around from your phones control, it’s video quality is better, and no subscription is needed for recording and storing data, all you need is a micro usb!! Very happy I grab this. It was extremely easy to install. 10/10 recommend and for a fantastic price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better than most!
reviews.reviewText: Of all the cheap ($30-$40 range) cameras I've bought, this one has lasted longer than the other ones which usually stop working in less than a year. It's pretty easy to set up and easy to turn on or off from home or away on your phone. The memory card is not included but great to buy for recording and to watch footage back. The night vision is good and the regular daytime footage is very clear. The only thing I don't like about it is when you use the microphone it makes a super loud noise before you talk that scares my cats everytime. I tried turning the volume down in the settings but it doesn't change.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pet camera perfect for our kitten
reviews.reviewText: This pet camera is nice for the price! Obviously it doesn't have all the same bells and whistles that more expensive options have, but it works well with our alexa and lets us watch our baby kitten when shes home alone while we're out at work or running errands. The picture quality is good enough and we really like that it swivels to show us our whole apartment. The app is easy enough to use and we won't be getting rid of this device any time soon. It's so great if you need a little peace of mind while your pet(s) are home alone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great and affordable
reviews.reviewText: This camera is great for the price. I use it as a pet camera and I'm very pleased with it. I like that it works with Google and I can bring up the camera feed on my Google home and still keep an eye out on my pets while I'm cooking. Image quality is great for the purpose Im using it for and the app is easy to use. I also like how you have the option to add an SD card to record as well. Overall I definitely recommend it if you need it for similar reasons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value for a very versatile and feature packed remote camera.
reviews.reviewText: These cameras are excellent! The price paid is minimal compared to the total amount of functionality.They do track objects that trigger them, maybe not as smoothly as higher priced options (I don’t know, have not tried others).For the mobility of relocating the camera by simply picking it up and finding a new location, it’s massively more practical than the full wired systems available. Until you know where you want those more expensive cameras to be permanently installed, these cameras are a great alternative! Also, great for keeping a watch on who’s passing by your place at window-level.Wired cameras have to be mounted high enough to be safe from getting ripped down by trespassers, these see through windows during the day very well. Interior night vision is top notch, seeing outside through windows at night is more difficult.With the sensitivity turned up, every time a tree branch blows it triggers the cameras. This leads to near constant triggering of alerts during the late Spring, Summer and early Fall.And, lots of recordings every day. So, you need to use the App to designate areas to watch for motion, or it’ll drive you nuts and frustrate you. To the point that you may start to ignore the notices.The App provides great control, and allows remote on/off, sensitivity setting changes, you can set to record noise triggers or remove that, set trigger zones, move the camera via the App, and other adjustments.I have noticed that the App actually does offer more functions, and work a little more smoothly, through my phone than my very new tablet. No idea why, it should be the same App for both platforms, no?But, of course watching the playback on the larger screen is so much better, so I do use both.The service plan allows storage of recordings from up to 10 cameras for $10 per month. Much more cost effective than others I looked into.The cons:Can’t see thru glass with the built-in lights, at night. Reflection off the glass blinds the camera.That should have been obvious to me from the start, since these are designed for indoor use only. but I had naively hoped for better night vision performance.So, if looking out a window, get a motion-activated light to trigger so you can see what’s going on out there. Just don’t set it up where it will shine in your bedroom and wake you up.App functionality on phone is higher than on tablet, no idea why. You will want to have the App on at least a phone, if not both.Sometimes, some cameras will trigger, others won’t, for the same event.Deer moving around the house sometimes are ignored by one camera, recorded by another. Also happened that another outdoor camera from another manufacturer recorded a vehicle trespassing, these cameras didn’t. Had to adjust the sensor sensitivity, but I think the baseline software settings should be set to trigger sooner on vehicles.Branches moving on the breeze cause constant notices, even with Person Detection Mode activated.A more elaborate software system might offer better monitoring, but for the pro systems, this requires fully wired systems with dedicated main recording components/control systems . Much more expensive, and I can’t afford to open the walls throughout the property.Overall, these are great! I have bought several models, both the fixed ones and the bigger moving ones. All look great when set to the highest recording resolution, seem to last a long time, and are a breeze to set up or switch from spot to spot.I very much recommend this camera! I also hope the manufacturer can produce a 4K version.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars PICK THE CHEAPER ONE FOR AUDIO TO SAVE
reviews.reviewText: I should of picked the cheaper camera, but thought the 2k one would be better. Unfortunately, the 2k option on the camera does not save recordings to the sd card. So I have to use the video quality of the cheaper camera option for any videos to save. Also, they need more instructions, it took a minute to find the sd card slot, and it wouldn’t read the sd card until I held down the reset button next to the card slot. All in all, the camera is good for the price. 2k quality definitely not needed, so save those few extra dollars and get the cheaper option. You can see very clearly without the 2k. The night vision on this is amazing as well. This has better video quality than baby monitors, trail cameras, and any security cameras I’ve seen. Oh! One more thing. It’s delayed by at least 30 seconds. So any movement is actually a little behind. Other than that, pretty good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect remote monitor for my attic
reviews.reviewText: I installed one of these cameras in my attic to ensure that I don’t get any unwanted rodent guests. Used with the Kasa phone app this is a great monitoring solution. I added an inexpensive micro SD card for recording. You can setup multiple viewing angles to quickly survey the area remotely when required. It will automatically notify your phone when motion is detected and the recording allows to review the activity. Thankfully, so far it has only seen the occasional moth. It has saved me many trips up to the attic and has worked well for many months. I also have many kasa wifi light and outlet switches which also work very well. This is an excellent product.

reviews.reviewTitle: No trae la opción de Kasa Care para México
reviews.reviewText: Súper fácil de instalar, calidad buena. Lo único muy malo es que no trae opción de suscripción a Kasa Care y así solo puedes utilizar las funciones básicas (y no de grabado en cloud por ejemplo).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2023

reviews.reviewText: Will definitely order more and compatible accessories. Thank you.
No las puedo vincular amigo , que tengo que hacer
